alert.note: Alert for Ventura (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 22 at 4:27AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by moderate to locally heavy rainfall is expected. * WHERE...West and central Ventura County of southwest California. * WHEN...Until 700 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent, including roads, freeways, and parking lots. Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Enhanced runoff in creeks is expected, and some low-water crossings may become impassable. Significant or damaging flooding is NOT expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 423 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate to locally heavy rain over the area, with rain rates between 0.25 and 0.50 inches per hour. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oxnard, Ventura, Camarillo, Fillmore, Ojai, Moorpark, Santa Paula, Highway 33, and Lake Casitas. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away of small creeks and rivers.
